Detailed Description

Class for converting polar image data vectors (radar spokes) into a single cartesian image.

Definition at line 48 of file PPIController.h.

void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetFrameBuffer ( intptr_t  pBuffer,
uint32_t  width,
uint32_t  height,
tRadarColourLookUpTable *  pLookUpTable,
uint32_t  xCentre,
uint32_t  yCentre 
)

Function that is used to set information on where image will be drawn.

Parameters
pBufferRadar frame buffer where spoke will be drawn
widthWidth of the memory frame buffer
heightHeight of the memory frame buffer
pLookUpTablePointer to the colour look up table
xCentreX-centre coordinate of where the PPI will be drawn (default Width/2)
yCentreY-centre coordinate of where the PPI will be drawn (default Height/2)
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetColourLookUpTable ( tRadarColourLookUpTable *  pLookUpTable)

Function that is used to set the new colour map.

Parameters
pLookUpTablepointer to the colour look up table
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::Process ( const Protocol::NRP::Spoke::t9174Spoke *  pSpoke)

Function that is used to add a spoke that will be drawn using the PPI representation.

Parameters
pSpokeSpoke will be added to the PPI
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetAzimuthInterpolation ( tPPIAzimuthInterpolation  azimuthInterp)

Enable different kind of azimuth interpolation.

Parameters
azimuthInterpIt can be eAzimuthInterpolationNone (doesn't perform any azimuth interpolation and draws holes if huge azimuth are missing) or eAzimuthInterpolationRepeat (it repeats last spoke to fill the azimuth gap)
tPPIAzimuthInterpolation Navico::Image::tPPIController::GetAzimuthInterpolation ( ) const

Return the type of azimuth interpolation used.

Returns
It can be eAzimuthInterpolationNone (doesn't perform any azimuth interpolation and draws holes if huge azimuth are missing) or eAzimuthInterpolationRepeat (it repeats last spoke to fill the azimuth gap)
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetRangeInterpolation ( tPPIRangeInterpolation  rangeInterp)

Enable different kind of range interpolation used.

Parameters
rangeInterpIt can be eRangeInterpolationNone (doesn't perform any range interpolation and each single spoke sample is mapped as pixel) or eRangeInterpolationPeak (it uses the range resolution value to express how many meters represents each single pixel)
tPPIRangeInterpolation Navico::Image::tPPIController::GetRangeInterpolation ( ) const

Return the type of range interpolation used.

Returns
It can be eRangeInterpolationNone (doesn't perform any range interpolation and each pixel is mapped to a single spoke sample) or eRangeInterpolationPeak (it uses the range resolution value to express how many meters represents each single pixel)
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetRangeResolution ( float  metersPerPixel)

Sets the range resolution as meters per pixels (how many meters will be mapped for a pixel)

Parameters
metersPerPixelThe new range resolution
float Navico::Image::tPPIController::GetRangeResolution ( ) const

Returns the current range resolution.

Returns
It returns the range resolution expressed as meters per pixel
bool Navico::Image::tPPIController::GetTrailsOn ( )

Returns if target trails are on.

Returns
The state of trails
void Navico::Image::tPPIController::SetTrailsTime ( int32_t  time_sec)

Sets the trails time.

Parameters
time_secThe time expressed in seconds: 0 = off, -1 = infinite, otherwise the time expressed in seconds
int32_t Navico::Image::tPPIController::GetTrailsTime ( )

Return the trails time.

Returns
The time expressed in seconds: 0 = off, -1 = infinite, otherwise the time expressed in seconds

uint32_t &  minor,
uint32_t &  build
